meanings.definition: A type of bread or cake made with oatmeal.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious bonnock for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sells fresh bonnocks every morning.
meanings.sent3: The bonnock looked so good, I almost wanted to frame it!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and comforting as a freshly baked bonnock.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the bonnock filled the kitchen, making my mouth water.

meanings.sent1: She offered me a bonnock with my tea.
meanings.sent2: The children happily munched on the sweet bonnocks.
meanings.sent3: The bonnock rolled off the plate and onto the floor, much to the dog's delight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a plate of bonnocks - infectious and sweet.
meanings.sent5: The bonnock melted in my mouth, leaving a sugary aftertaste.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally bonnocked his head on the low doorway.
meanings.sent2: The boxer trained hard to bonnock his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: She bonnocked the nail into the wall with precision.
meanings.sent4: The storm bonnocked against the windows all night long.
meanings.sent5: The hammer bonnocked loudly, echoing through the workshop.
